OFFICE OF
The Bod of
KANCHIKACHERLA Nature-
You are the daughter of the family. Due to the love I have for you, I want to give you some immovable property as a reward and free of charge, and I have inherited it in the village of Kanchikacherla as a pre-emptive right and have registered it in Kanchikacherla and till today, I have full and complete ownership rights in my name in the records of the Gram Panchayat. I have all the rights and complete rights of the property until the day of donation and sale. I will not do any wrong to anyone in the schedule of inheritance. The immovable property worth Rs. 6,00,000/- (literally six lakh rupees) is hereby transferred to you free of charge. The said property shall be transferred to you with full rights on this day. From now on, you shall take possession of the said property as per the schedule and shall pay the Panchayat taxes etc. yourself and you, your son, grandson, etc., shall enjoy it freely and comfortably, with all rights of land, water, rock, treasure, deposit, stone, etc., with the right of donation, exchange, sale and all rights of land, water, stone, treasure, deposit, stone, etc., as per your wish. Whether regarding your rights or regarding the rights of your heirs, I, my heirs, assigns, representatives, etc., shall be free from any and all obstacles arising from my own expenses and from the liability of my other movable and immovable properties and shall execute your application without interruption. This land is not a free patta given by the Government and is not an assigned land under Ordinance 9/77. The transfer of patta has been filed. From now on, you will be able to pay the Panchayat taxes etc. In order to register your name in the Gram Panchayat records, the following information has been filed. I am fully responsible for all transactions related to the property.
I hereby confirm all the above mentioned items and in future, I will I will be fully responsible for all legal transactions and actions related to any inaccuracies. The Sub-Registrar, the office staff, the clerk who prepared the document, and the person who prepared the document, shall not be liable for any misrepresentation or error in connection with this document, which is being registered today. The document is being prepared and registered in accordance with the details furnished by me. R.Kavi Tha, the undersigned, declares that the original title deeds, property tax receipts, other approvals and encumbrance certificates of the schedule property in respect of this document and all other necessary details are available to me. I have given them. I have not transferred the property in this document to anyone before.
I hereby register this document in the name of the person who has registered the property in the schedule, believing that no other person has any right to transfer the property except me.
I hereby confirm all the above and take full responsibility for all legal transactions and actions related to any of the above matters in the future. If necessary, I can write amendments and confirmation documents to this document.

sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 410 of 2026, dated 23/Jan/2026, executed by Taluri Venkata Narasamma in favour of her daughter, Rachakonda Kavitha, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 62 Sq. Yds, bearing house number 10-807, Assessment number 203276002142, comprised in survey number 452-2, situated in Kanchikacherla Village and Grama panchayath, Kanchikacherla Mandal, within the District of NTR registered at sub-registrar office Kanchikacherla is bounded as follows: North by: House of Bodepalli Ravi South by: House of Gude Lakshmi Narasamma East by: Panchayat Cement Road West by: Road
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.

Note: It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
